posts.name: Jayden
posts.cooked: Heya folks, its me again. Hope y’all are having a great day. If possible, would you be so kind to pass along an example of how to create and implement named commands in PathPlanner? Thank you very much and I hope you have a nice rest of your day.

posts.name: Micah
posts.cooked:
You can use “ NamedCommands.registerCommand(“Command Name”, new command(…)); ” in the robot container to add commands to PathPlanner. It should show up in PathPlanner under the “Command Name” after selecting a named command.

Also, I love how you name these threads

posts.name: Jayden
posts.cooked:
Thank you very much for this resource, my team and I have already studied this example and would be in need of a real example. Such as code relating to pathplanner from another folk’s team.

But thank you for the response and for the compliment, have a great rest of your day.

posts.name: Nisala
Jayden
posts.cooked: Thank you so much. This was quite what I was looking for. I hope everybody here has a great day. And thank you again. Have a nice rest of your evening.
